title: Create Tool, ToolType, and Catalog Pydantic models

task.title: Create Tool, ToolType, and Catalog Pydantic models
task.description:
## Context
Define the core data models that represent tools and the catalog. These models are used throughout Toolsmith for data validation, serialization, and type safety.

## Implementation Hints

**Recommended Model:** haiku
**Estimated Duration:** 1h
**Approach:** Follow existing Cub patterns from `cub/core/captures/models.py`. Use Pydantic v2 with `model_config`, Field validators, and enums for type safety.

## Implementation Steps
1. Create `src/cub/core/toolsmith/__init__.py` (empty, for package)
2. Create `src/cub/core/toolsmith/models.py`
3. Define `ToolType` enum (MCP_SERVER, SKILL)
4. Define `Tool` model with all fields from architecture
5. Define `Catalog` model with version, timestamps, and tools list
6. Add `model_config` for JSON serialization settings

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `ToolType` enum has `MCP_SERVER` and `SKILL` values
- [ ] `Tool` model has: id, name, source, source_url, tool_type, description, install_hint, tags, last_seen
- [ ] `Catalog` model has: version, last_sync, sources_synced, tools
- [ ] Models can be serialized to/from JSON via `model_dump()` / `model_validate()`
- [ ] ID validation ensures format `{source}:{slug}`
- [ ] mypy passes with strict mode

## Files Likely Involved
- `src/cub/core/toolsmith/__init__.py` (new)
- `src/cub/core/toolsmith/models.py` (new)

## Notes
- Reference `cub/core/captures/models.py` for Pydantic v2 patterns
- Use `datetime` from stdlib, ensure timezone handling matches Cub conventions
- Keep models simple - no business logic, just data + validation
